verses.verse: The word<WH1697> of Jehovah<WH3068> which came to Jeremiah<WH3414> the prophet<WH5030> concerning the nations<WH1471>.

Of Egypt<WH4714>: concerning the army<WH2428> of Pharaoh-neco<WH6549> king<WH4428> of Egypt<WH4714>, which was by the river<WH5104> Euphrates<WH6578> in Carchemish<WH3751>, which Nebuchadrezzar<WH5019> king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894> smote<WH5221> in the fourth<WH7243> year<WH8141> of Jehoiakim<WH3079> the son<WH1121> of Josiah<WH2977>, king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063>.
Prepare <WH6186> ye the buckler<WH4043> and shield<WH6793>, and draw near<WH5066> to battle<WH4421>.

Harness <WH631> the horses<WH5483>, and get up<WH5927>, ye horsemen<WH6571>, and stand forth<WH3320> with your helmets<WH3553>; furbish<WH4838> the spears<WH7420>, put on<WH3847> the coats of mail<WH5630>.

Wherefore have I seen<WH7200> it<WH2844>? they are dismayed and are turned<WH5472> backward<WH268>; and their mighty ones<WH1368> are beaten down<WH3807>, and are fled<WH5127> apace<WH4498>, and look not back<WH6437>: terror<WH4032> is on every side<WH5439>, saith<WH5002> Jehovah<WH3068>.

Let not the swift<WH7031> flee away<WH5127>, nor the mighty man<WH1368> escape<WH4422>; in the north<WH6828> by<WH3027> the river<WH5104> Euphrates<WH6578> have they stumbled<WH3782> and fallen<WH5307>.
Who is this that riseth up<WH5927> like the Nile<WH2975>, whose waters<WH4325> toss<WH1607> themselves like the rivers<WH5104>?

Egypt <WH4714> riseth up<WH5927> like the Nile<WH2975>, and his waters<WH4325> toss<WH1607> themselves like the rivers<WH5104>: and he saith<WH559>, I will rise up<WH5927>, I will cover<WH3680> the earth<WH776>; I will destroy<WH6> cities<WH5892> and the inhabitants thereof<WH3427>.

Go up<WH5927>, ye horses<WH5483>; and rage<WH1984>, ye chariots<WH7393>; and let the mighty men<WH1368> go forth<WH3318>: Cush<WH3568> and Put<WH6316>, that handle<WH8610> the shield<WH4043>; and the Ludim<WH3866>, that handle<WH8610> and bend<WH1869> the bow<WH7198>.

For that day is a day<WH3117> of the Lord<WH136>, Jehovah<WH136> of hosts<WH6635>, a day<WH3117> of vengeance<WH5360>, that he may avenge<WH5358> him of his adversaries<WH6862>: and the sword<WH2719> shall devour<WH398> and be satiate<WH7646>, and shall drink<WH7301> its fill of their blood<WH1818>; for the Lord<WH136>, Jehovah<WH3069> of hosts<WH6635>, hath a sacrifice<WH2077> in the north<WH6828> country<WH776> by the river<WH5104> Euphrates<WH6578>.

Go up<WH5927> into Gilead<WH1568>, and take<WH3947> balm<WH6875>, O virgin<WH1330> daughter<WH1323> of Egypt<WH4714>: in vain<WH7723> dost thou use many<WH7235> medicines<WH7499>; there is no healing for thee<WH8585>.

The nations<WH1471> have heard<WH8085> of thy shame<WH7036>, and the earth<WH776> is full of thy cry<WH6682>; for the mighty<WH1368> man<WH1368> hath stumbled<WH3782> against the mighty<WH1368>, they are fallen<WH5307> both<WH8147> of them together<WH3162>.

The word<WH1697> that Jehovah<WH3068> spake<WH1696> to Jeremiah<WH3414> the prophet<WH5030>, how that Nebuchadrezzar<WH5019> king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894> should come<WH935> and smite<WH5221> the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>.

Declare <WH5046> ye in Egypt<WH4714>, and publish<WH8085> in Migdol<WH4024>, and publish<WH8085> in Memphis<WH5297> and in Tahpanhes<WH8471>: say<WH559> ye<WH3320>, Stand forth, and prepare<WH3559> thee<WH2719>; for the sword hath devoured<WH398> round about thee<WH5439>.
Why are thy strong<WH47> ones swept away<WH5502>? they stood<WH5975> not<WH3068>, because Jehovah did drive them<WH1920>.

He made many<WH7235> to stumble<WH3782>, yea<WH5307>, they fell one<WH376> upon another<WH7453>: and they said<WH559>, Arise<WH6965>, and let us go again<WH7725> to our own people<WH5971>, and to the land<WH776> of our nativity<WH4138>, from<WH6440> the oppressing<WH3238> sword<WH2719>.
They cried<WH7121> there<WH6547>, Pharaoh king<WH4428> of Egypt<WH4714> is but a noise<WH7588>; he hath let the appointed<WH4150> time pass by<WH5674>.

As I live<WH2416>, saith<WH5002> the King<WH4428>, whose name<WH8034> is Jehovah<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>, surely like Tabor<WH8396> among the mountains<WH2022>, and like Carmel<WH3760> by the sea<WH3220>, so shall he come<WH935>.

O thou daughter<WH1323> that dwellest<WH3427> in Egypt<WH4714>, furnish<WH6213> thyself to go into captivity<WH3627>; for Memphis<WH5297> shall become a desolation<WH8047>, and shall be burnt<WH3341> up<WH3427>, without inhabitant.
Egypt <WH4714> is a very fair<WH3304> heifer<WH5697>; but destruction<WH7171> out<WH935> of the north<WH6828> is come<WH935>, it is come.

Also her hired men<WH7916> in the midst<WH7130> of her are like calves<WH5695> of the stall<WH4770>; for they also are turned back<WH6437>, they are fled away<WH5127> together<WH3162>, they did not stand<WH5975>: for the day<WH3117> of their calamity<WH343> is come<WH935> upon them<WH6256>, the time of their visitation<WH6486>.

The sound<WH6963> thereof shall go<WH3212> like the serpent<WH5175>; for they shall march<WH3212> with an army<WH2428>, and come<WH935> against her with axes<WH7134>, as hewers<WH2404> of wood<WH6086>.
They shall cut down<WH3772> her forest<WH3293>, saith<WH5002> Jehovah<WH3068>, though it cannot be searched<WH2713>; because they are more<WH7231> than the locusts<WH697>, and are innumerable<WH369>.
The daughter<WH1323> of Egypt<WH4714> shall be put to shame<WH3001>; she shall be delivered<WH5414> into the hand<WH3027> of the people<WH5971> of the north<WH6828>.

Jehovah <WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>, the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, saith<WH559>: Behold<WH6485>, I will punish Amon<WH527> of No<WH4996>, and Pharaoh<WH6547>, and Egypt<WH4714>, with her gods<WH430>, and her kings<WH4428>; even Pharaoh<WH6547>, and them that trust in him<WH982>:

and I will deliver<WH5414> them into the hand<WH3027> of those that seek<WH1245> their lives<WH5315>, and into the hand<WH3027> of Nebuchadrezzar<WH5019> king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894>, and into the hand<WH3027> of his servants<WH5650>; and afterwards<WH310> it shall be inhabited<WH7931>, as in the days<WH3117> of old<WH6924>, saith<WH5002> Jehovah<WH3068>.

But fear<WH3372> not thou<WH3290>, O Jacob my servant<WH5650>, neither be dismayed<WH2865>, O Israel<WH3478>: for<WH3467>, lo, I will save thee from afar<WH7350>, and thy seed<WH2233> from the land<WH776> of their captivity<WH7628>; and Jacob<WH3290> shall return<WH7725>, and shall be quiet<WH8252> and at ease<WH7599>, and none shall make him afraid<WH2729>.

Fear <WH3372> not thou<WH3290>, O Jacob my servant<WH5650>, saith<WH5002> Jehovah<WH3068>; for I am with thee<WH6213>: for I will make a full end<WH3617> of all the nations<WH1471> whither I have driven<WH5080> thee<WH6213>; but I will not make a full end<WH3617> of thee<WH3256>, but I will correct thee in measure<WH4941>, and will in no wise<WH5352> leave thee unpunished<WH5352>.
